   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% Test the garbage collector (or Memory Recycler)
   22: 
   23: -module(gc_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("eunit/include/eunit.hrl").
   27: 
   28: -export([all/0, suite/0]).
   29: 
   30: -export([
   31:     grow_heap/1,
   32:     grow_stack/1,
   33:     grow_stack_heap/1,
   34:     max_heap_size/1,
   35:     max_heap_size_large_hfrag/1,
   36:     minor_major_gc_option_async/1,
   37:     minor_major_gc_option_self/1,
   38:     gc_signal_order/1,
   39:     gc_dirty_exec_proc/1,
   40:     alias_signals_in_gc/1
   41: ]).
   42: 
   43: suite() ->
   44:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   45: 
   46: all() -> 
   47:     [grow_heap, grow_stack, grow_stack_heap, max_heap_size,
   48:      max_heap_size_large_hfrag,
   49:     minor_major_gc_option_self,
   50:     minor_major_gc_option_async, gc_signal_order, gc_dirty_exec_proc,
   51:     alias_signals_in_gc].
   52: 
   53: 
   54: %% Produce a growing list of elements,
   55: %% for X calls, then drop one item per call
   56: %% until the list is empty.
   57: grow_heap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   58:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 40}),
   59:     ok  = grow_heap1(256),
   60:     ok  = grow_heap1(512),
   61:     ok  = grow_heap1(1024),
   62:     ok  = grow_heap1(2048),
   63:     ok.
   64: 
   65: grow_heap1(Len) ->
   66:     io:format("~ngrow_heap with ~p items.",[Len]),
   67:     show_heap("before:"),
   68:     grow_heap1([], Len, 0, up),
   69:     show_heap("after:").
   70: 
   71: grow_heap1(List, MaxLen, MaxLen, up) ->
   72:     show_heap("top:"),
   73:     grow_heap1(List, MaxLen, MaxLen-1, down);
   74: grow_heap1(List, MaxLen, CurLen, up) ->
   75:     NewList=[make_arbit()|List],
   76:     grow_heap1(NewList, MaxLen, CurLen+1, up);
   77: grow_heap1([], _MaxLen, _, down) ->
   78:     ok;
   79: grow_heap1([_|List], MaxLen, CurLen, down) ->
   80:     C=erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
   81:     Num     = C rem (length(List))+1,
   82:     Elem    = lists:nth(Num, List),
   83:     NewList = lists:delete(Elem, List),
   84:     grow_heap1(NewList, MaxLen, CurLen-1, down).
   85: 
   86: 
   87: 
   88: %% Increase and decrease stack size, and
   89: %% drop off some garbage from time to time.
   90: grow_stack(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   91:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 80}),
   92:     show_heap("before:"),
   93:     grow_stack1(200, 0),
   94:     show_heap("after:"),
   95:     ok.
   96: 
   97: grow_stack1(0, _) ->
   98:     ok;
   99: grow_stack1(Recs, 0) ->
  100: %    show_heap("running:"),
  101:     grow_stack1(Recs-1, Recs),
  102:     grow_stack1(0,0);
  103: grow_stack1(Recs, CurRecs) ->
  104:     grow_stack1(Recs, CurRecs-1),
  105:     make_arbit(),
  106:     grow_stack1(1,0),
  107:     ok.
  108: 
  109: 
  110: %% Let's see how BEAM handles this one...
  111: %% While growing the heap, bounces the size of the
  112: %% stack, and while reducing the heap, bounces the stack usage.
  113: grow_stack_heap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  114:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 40}),
  115:     grow_stack_heap1(16),
  116:     grow_stack_heap1(32),
  117:     ok.
  118: 
  119: grow_stack_heap1(MaxLen) ->
  120:     io:format("~ngrow_stack_heap with ~p items.",[MaxLen]),
  121:     show_heap("before:"),
  122:     grow_stack_heap1([], MaxLen, 0, up),
  123:     show_heap("after:").
  124: 
  125: grow_stack_heap1(List, MaxLen, MaxLen, up) ->
  126:     show_heap("top:"),
  127:     grow_stack_heap1(List, MaxLen, MaxLen-1, down);
  128: grow_stack_heap1(List, MaxLen, CurLen, up) ->
  129:     grow_stack1(CurLen*2,0),
  130:     grow_stack_heap1([make_arbit()|List], MaxLen, CurLen+1, up),
  131:     ok;
  132: 
  133: grow_stack_heap1([], _MaxLen, _, down) -> ok;
  134: grow_stack_heap1([_|List], MaxLen, CurLen, down) ->
  135:     grow_stack1(CurLen*2,0),
  136:     C=erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  137:     Num=C rem (length(List))+1,
  138:     Elem=lists:nth(Num, List),
  139:     NewList=lists:delete(Elem, List),
  140:     grow_stack_heap1(NewList, MaxLen, CurLen-1, down),
  141:     ok.
  142: 
  143: 
  144: %% Create an arbitrary element/term.
  145: make_arbit() ->
  146:     {AA,BB,CC}=erlang:timestamp(),
  147:     A=AA+1, B=BB+1, C=(CC+erlang:unique_integer([positive])) rem 1000000 + 1,
  148:     New =
  149: 	case C rem 9 of
  150: 	    0 -> make_string((B div C) +5);
  151: 	    1 -> C;
  152: 	    2 -> make_ref();
  153: 	    3 -> self();
  154: 	    4 -> list_to_binary(make_string((C div B) + 12));
  155: 	    5 -> (C*B)/(A+1);
  156: 	    6 -> list_to_tuple(make_string((B div C) +5));
  157: 	    7 -> list_to_atom(make_string(((C div B) rem 254) + 2));
  158: 	    8 -> fun(X) -> {X,AA,make_string((B div C)+10)} end
  159: 	end,
  160:     New.
  161: 
  162: %% Create an arbitrary string of a certain length.
  163: make_string(Length) ->
  164:     Alph="abcdefghjiklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"++
  165: 	"0123456789",
  166:     make_string(Alph, Length, []).
  167: 
  168: make_string(_, 0, Acc) ->
  169:     Acc;
  170: make_string(Alph, Length, Acc) ->
  171:     C=erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  172:     Pos=1+(Length*C rem length(Alph)),
  173:     make_string(Alph, Length-1, 
  174: 		[lists:nth(Pos,Alph)|Acc]).
  175: 
  176: show_heap(String) ->
  177:     garbage_collect(self()),
  178:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  179:     {heap_size, HSize}=process_info(self(), heap_size),
  180:     {stack_size, SSize}=process_info(self(), stack_size),
  181:     io:format("Heap/Stack "++String++"~p/~p", [HSize, SSize]).
  182:     
  183: %% Test that doing a remote GC that triggers the max heap size
  184: %% kills the process.
  185: max_heap_size(_Config) ->
  186: 
  187:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun long_receive/0,[{max_heap_size, 1024},
  188:                                         {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  189:     [Pid ! lists:duplicate(I,I) || I <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  190:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  191: 
  192:     %% Force messages to be viewed as part of heap
  193:     erlang:process_info(Pid, messages),
  194: 
  195:     %% Do the GC that triggers max heap
  196:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
  197: 
  198:     %% Verify that max heap was triggered
  199:     receive
  200:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, killed} -> ok
  201:     after 5000 ->
  202:             ct:fail({process_did_not_die, Pid, erlang:process_info(Pid)})
  203:     end.
  204: 
  205: long_receive() ->
  206:     receive
  207:     after 10000 ->
  208:             ok
  209:     end.
  210: 
  211: %% Trigger gc-after-bif with a large heap fragment, which provoked some bugs.
  212: max_heap_size_large_hfrag(Config) ->
  213:     max_heap_size_large_hfrag_do(),
  214:     %% Repeat with major GC
  215:     process_flag(fullsweep_after, 0),
  216:     max_heap_size_large_hfrag_do(),
  217:     ok.
  218: 
  219: max_heap_size_large_hfrag_do() ->
  220:     {Pid, Ref} =
  221:         spawn_opt(
  222:           fun Fun() ->
  223:                   erlang:make_tuple(2000, []),
  224:                   Fun()
  225:           end,
  226:           [monitor, {max_heap_size, 1000}]),
  227:     %% Verify that max heap was triggered
  228:     {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, killed} =
  229:         receive M -> M
  230:         after 5000 ->
  231:                 ct:fail({process_did_not_die, Pid, erlang:process_info(Pid)})
  232:         end,
  233:     ok.
  234: 
  235: minor_major_gc_option_self(_Config) ->
  236:     %% Try as major, the test process will self-trigger GC
  237:     check_gc_tracing_around(
  238:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
  239:             Pid ! {gc, Ref, major}
  240:         end, [gc_major_start, gc_major_end]),
  241: 
  242:     %% Try as major dirty, the test process will self-trigger GC
  243:     check_gc_tracing_around(
  244:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
  245:             Pid ! {gc, Ref, major}
  246:         end, [gc_major_start, gc_major_end],
  247:       lists:seq(1,128 * 1024)),
  248: 
  249:     %% Try as minor, the test process will self-trigger GC
  250:     check_gc_tracing_around(
  251:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
  252:             Pid ! {gc, Ref, minor}
  253:         end, [gc_minor_start, gc_minor_end]).
  254: 
  255: minor_major_gc_option_async(_Config) ->
  256:     %% Try with default option, must be major GC
  257:     check_gc_tracing_around(
  258:         fun(Pid, _Ref) ->
  259:             erlang:garbage_collect(Pid, [])
  260:         end, [gc_major_start, gc_major_end]),
  261: 
  262:     %% Try with the 'major' type
  263:     check_gc_tracing_around(
  264:         fun(Pid, _Ref) ->
  265:             erlang:garbage_collect(Pid, [{type, major}])
  266:         end, [gc_major_start, gc_major_end]),
  267: 
  268:     %% Try with 'minor' option, once
  269:     check_gc_tracing_around(
  270:         fun(Pid, _Ref) ->
  271:             erlang:garbage_collect(Pid, [{type, minor}])
  272:         end, [gc_minor_start, gc_minor_end]),
  273: 
  274:     %% Try with 'minor' option, once, async
  275:     check_gc_tracing_around(
  276:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
  277:             ?assertEqual(async,
  278:                 erlang:garbage_collect(Pid, [{type, minor}, {async, Ref}])),
  279: 
  280:             receive
  281:                 {garbage_collect, Ref, true} ->
  282:                     ok
  283:             after 10000 ->
  284:                 ct:fail("Did not receive a completion notification on async GC")
  285:             end
  286:         end, [gc_minor_start, gc_minor_end]).
  287: 
  288: gc_signal_order(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  289:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  290:     process_flag(priority, high),
  291:     Ref = make_ref(),
  292:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end,[{scheduler, 1}]),
  293:     spam_signals(Pid, 10000),
  294:     %% EXIT signal *should* arrive...
  295:     exit(Pid, kill),
  296:     %% ... before GC signal...
  297:     async = garbage_collect(Pid, [{async, Ref}]),
  298:     %% ... which means that the result of the gc *should* be 'false'...
  299:     false = busy_wait_gc_res(Ref),
  300:     ok.
  301: 
  302: busy_wait_gc_res(Ref) ->
  303:     receive
  304: 	{garbage_collect, Ref, Res} ->
  305: 	    Res
  306:     after 0 ->
  307: 	    busy_wait_gc_res(Ref)
  308:     end.
  309: 
  310: spam_signals(P, N) when N =< 0 ->
  311:     ok;
  312: spam_signals(P, N) ->
  313:     link(P),
  314:     unlink(P),
  315:     spam_signals(P, N-2).
  316: 
  317: gc_dirty_exec_proc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  318:     check_gc_tracing_around(
  319:       fun(Pid, _Ref) ->
  320: 	      Pid ! {dirty_exec, 1000},
  321: 	      receive after 100 -> ok end,
  322: 	      true = erlang:garbage_collect(Pid, [{type, major}])
  323:       end, [gc_major_start, gc_major_end]).
  324: 
  325: %% Traces garbage collection around the given operation, and fails the test if
  326: %% it results in any unexpected messages or if the expected trace tags are not
  327: %% received.
  328: check_gc_tracing_around(Fun, ExpectedTraceTags) ->
  329:     check_gc_tracing_around(Fun, ExpectedTraceTags, []).
  330: check_gc_tracing_around(Fun, ExpectedTraceTags, State) ->
  331:     Ref = erlang:make_ref(),
  332:     Pid = spawn(
  333:             fun() ->
  334:                     (fun Endless(S) ->
  335:                              receive
  336:                                  {gc, Ref, Type} ->
  337:                                      erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, Type}]);
  338:                                  {dirty_exec, Time} ->
  339:                                      erts_debug:dirty_io(wait, Time)
  340:                              after 100 ->
  341:                                      ok
  342:                              end,
  343:                              Endless(S)
  344:                      end)(State)
  345:             end),
  346:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid, []),
  347:     erlang:trace(Pid, true, [garbage_collection]),
  348:     Fun(Pid, Ref),
  349:     expect_trace_messages(Pid, ExpectedTraceTags),
  350:     erlang:trace(Pid, false, [garbage_collection]),
  351:     erlang:exit(Pid, kill),
  352:     check_no_unexpected_messages().
  353: 
  354: %% Ensures that trace messages with the provided tags have all been received
  355: %% within a reasonable timeframe.
  356: expect_trace_messages(_Pid, []) ->
  357:     ok;
  358: expect_trace_messages(Pid, [Tag | TraceTags]) ->
  359:     receive
  360:         {trace, Pid, Tag, _Data} ->
  361:             expect_trace_messages(Pid, TraceTags)
  362:     after 4000 ->
  363:         ct:fail("Didn't receive tag ~p within 4000ms", [Tag])
  364:     end.
  365: 
  366: check_no_unexpected_messages() ->
  367:     receive
  368:         Anything ->
  369:             ct:fail("Unexpected message: ~p", [Anything])
  370:     after 0 ->
  371:         ok
  372:     end.
  373: 
  374: alias_signals_in_gc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375:     %% Make sure alias signals in rootset won't cause
  376:     %% crashes...
  377:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  378:     process_flag(priority, normal),
  379:     process_flag(message_queue_data, on_heap),
  380:     Alias = alias(),
  381:     %% We deactivate the alias since it is no point converting
  382:     %% the alias signals into messages for this test...
  383:     unalias(Alias), 
  384:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  385: 			    alias_sig_spammer(Alias, 100000)
  386: 		    end, [{scheduler, 1}, {priority, high}, link]),
  387:     erlang:yield(),
  388:     do_gc(10),
  389:     unlink(Pid),
  390:     exit(Pid, bang),
  391:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
  392:     ok.
  393: 
  394: alias_sig_spammer(Alias, N) ->
  395:     alias_sig_spammer(Alias, N, N).
  396:     
  397: alias_sig_spammer(Alias, 0, NStart) ->
  398:     Alias ! [hello],
  399:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  400:     alias_sig_spammer(Alias, NStart, NStart);
  401: alias_sig_spammer(Alias, N, NStart) ->
  402:     Alias ! [hello],
  403:     alias_sig_spammer(Alias, N-1, NStart).
  404: 
  405: do_gc(0) ->
  406:     ok;
  407: do_gc(N) ->
  408:     garbage_collect(),
  409:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  410:     do_gc(N-1).
